label: Folder 17: Howells Letter 1
description: Letter to Robert N.S. Whitelaw. from John Mead Howells (Dec. 6, 1939) declining the chairmanship of a committee that would oversee the architectural survey.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: JOHN, MEAD HOWES   .ARC HITE C T   156 least 46TH STREET NEW YORK   CHICAGo: TRUNE TOWER TRIBUNE SQUARE HOWE S AND AlbertSON : SEATTE     December 6, 1939.   Robert N.S. Wniteaw, Esq., Director   Carolina Art  Association Gibbes Art Gallery   Charleston, South Carolina   Dear Bob:   I am just off the train from the west and find your letter to me of November 30, encosing copy of a letter to Frederick Keppe, President of the Carnegie Corporation, rehearsing the possibiity of a compete survey of conditions in Charleston with a view to instituting an amagamation of a cultural interests, under the eadership of a committee, and apparenty suggesting me as chairman.   I cannot say too clearly that I cai ot acceptsuch a chairmanship . I recognize the compiment of such a suggestion and thank you for it, but it is hot possibe.   I I shall be gad to see Frederick Keppe and to speak with ove and enthusiasm for Charleston as I aways do, but I must also note this decision to him.   Whoy aside from this matter, I think Charleston deserves his hep and I shall te him so.   I I   Yourr Sincerey,    .   .. . . . . . . . . . . . . . .. . . . .   Jom Mead Howes.
